search_parameters.q: Some Plan to Become Teachers: Determinants of Career Specification among Rural Youth in Norway, Germany, and the United States Schwarzweller, Harry K. Lyson, Thomas A. Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: Some Plan to Become Teachers: Determinants of Career Specification among Rural Youth in Norway, Germany, and the United States Schwarzweller, Harry K. Lyson, Thomas A. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Some plan to become teachers: Determinants of career specification among rural youth in Norway, Germany, and the United States
organic_results.snippet: This comparative study deals with the selection of teaching as a career goal. To comprehend the meaning of observed differences in the relative popularity of teaching vis-a-vis other professional career alternatives, the general patterning of status ambitions is also explored. Sex and class differentials hold cross-nationally and are maintained with other variables controlled. A career in teaching is an important means for lower status youths and girls in general, to achieve a modest degree of upward social mobility. As entree into …

publication_info.summary: HK Schwarzweller, TA Lyson - Sociology of Education, 1978 - JSTOR

organic_results.title: Some Plan to Become Teachers: Determinants of Career Specification Among Rural Youth in Norway, Germany and the United States.
organic_results.snippet: Focusing specifically on teaching as a career goal among rural youth in Norway, Germany, and the United States, this cross-national comparative study took into account the general patterning of career ambitions in each society--upward mobility opportunities, status attainment strategies, and organizational character of the educational systems (sorting-out mechanisms). Sex, place of residence (community context), father's occupational status, and achieved scholastic performance level were considered as determinants of career choosing …
